Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Sontarans enter the ice house, shut the door and go down the ladder into the passageway. Chessene enters and drops a canister down through the trapdoor. It goes off like a Roman Candle. Varl grabs his head and collapses. Chessene drops the second canister and Stike starts to melt. Chessene walks outside and crosses the courtyard to the main house.

Dialogue.Line: Looks like Chessene's won.
Yeah
Doctor.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Shockeye and the second Doctor are walking outside the outer wall, wearing top hats and tails.

Dialogue.Line: Quail pate, I think, Shockeye, followed by a bisque de crevettes, hmm? I know an eating house
Now where are they going?
They look quite pally.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Dastari and Chessene enter.

Dialogue.Line: Where have they gone?
They're hunting food.
If the Doctor isn't stabilised within the hour
He'll reject the transfusion. I'm well aware of that.
We must find them.
Wait. On this planet there is little hunting. The Doña Arana remembers many restaurants in Sevilla. That is where they shall be. Come!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Dastari follows Chessene out, and Stike emerges from behind a pillar. He has lots of green slime on his face.

Dialogue.Line: Treacherous hag. I shall return to destroy this Androgum filth.
Tell me, on this planet, do they ever eat their own?
I believe in the Far Indies it has been known, but I remember a dish, shepherd's pie.
Shepherd's pie? A shepherd. Can't we walk quicker?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The sixth Doctor, Jamie and Peri are running to catch up.
The lane runs alongside a tarmaced road.

Dialogue.Line: Wait. There's a machine coming.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The second Doctor runs to flag down a small Ebro truck. Shockeye picks up a stout piece of tree branch. As the driver leans out of his cab to ask the Doctor's motives, Shockeye hits him and he rolls away from the road.

Dialogue.Line: Can you drive this machine?
Of course I can. Get in, my friend. We shall be in Seville in five minutes!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor, Jamie and Peri run up as the truck drives off.

Dialogue.Line: I can't believe that was my Doctor just standing there and letting a man get killed.
Right now I'm afraid he's eighty percent Androgum. By the time the effect reaches me it will be close to a hundred percent.
Reaches you?
And it will, unless we can save him. I'm already beginning to feel changes.
Eh? Well, come on, then.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Stike pulls the control panel from the outside of the Kartz-Reimer module and takes it inside with him. He slots it into place, closes the door and operates it. The module shakes and fills with smoke, then electricity arcs above him. He falls out.

Dialogue.Line: My space craft.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Plaza del Trifuno, I think, by the cathedral.

Dialogue.Line: Oh, look, we'll never find him here, Doctor.
It's too big.
Look!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The stolen truck is parked across the road. They run across and the Doctor touches the bonnet.

Dialogue.Line: They can't be more than a minute ahead of us. This way, I think.
How do you know?
Peri, it is me we're following.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Chessene and Dastari enter the plaza in a horse-drawn carriage.

Dialogue.Line: I still don't understand it.
What?
Well, that you and the Doctor, well, my Doctor are the same person.
Of course we're the same, but different. You only have to see how my sartorial taste has improved, for instance.
But how can two of you be together at the same point in space and time?
When you travel around as much as I do, it's almost inevitable that you'll run into yourself at some point. Come on.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Meanwhile, Shockeye and the second Doctor have reached Plaza Alianza.

Dialogue.Line: Personally I have never seen the necessity for starting a meal with a, what was your word?
Hors d'oeuvres.
Quite unnecessary, in my opinion. Eight or nine main dishes are quite enough in my opinion.

Well, on this planet it is the custom. All the greatest chefs agree, Carema, Brillat Savaran, the noble Escoffier, they all agree that one should begin with a light dish, something to bring relish to the appetite. Pate du foie gras de Strasburg on croute, for instance, or a serving of Beylon oysters. Even a, even a light salad with artichoke hearts and country ham will suffice. It gets the digestive juices flowing!
How much further is this place?
It's just round the next corner, if I remember rightly.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor, Peri and Jamie are walking down the Calle Justino del Neve when they see Chessene and Dastari at the far end. They dive into a doorway. Seeing nothing, the aliens go up to La Hosteria del Laurel.

Dialogue.Line: They're checking the restaurants. Something I should have thought of. Come on, let's find them before Chessene does.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Dastari comes out of the Hosteria and a young woman throws a flower down to him from her balcony. He picks it up and takes it to Chessene. Meanwhile, the dying Stike staggers out of the hacienda just as his space craft self-destructs, as per his orders.
Oscar Botcherby hands menus to customers then goes to a waiter.

Dialogue.Line: Juan, can you see to table six.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Then he goes over to the latest people to enter the restaurant. Anita is at the desk.

Dialogue.Line: Welcome to Las Cadenas, señors. Oh, how delightful to have see gentlemen of the old school. May I enquire if you have a booking?
Booking? I want food.
No reservation. Well, come this way. Fortunately, I have an excellent table for you.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Shockeye and the second Doctor follow Oscar through to their table.

Dialogue.Line: Do you serve humans here?
Most of the time, sir. Yes, I think I could venture to say that most of our customers are certainly human.
I mean human meat, you fawning imbecile.
No, sir. I'm afraid the nouvelle cuisine has not yet penetrated this establishment. Juan?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Peri comes out of Hostal Monreal on Calle Rodrigo Caro and meets up with the Doctor an Jamie nearby.

Dialogue.Line: No.
No luck?
No, just a load of tourists eating paella and chips.
No, didn't look the kind of place. They'd have gone for somewhere more elaborate.
What's wrong?
Oh, there's a cat.
What about it?
Well, they say there's more than one way to cook a cat. Here, pussy, pussy, puss-puss! Here, little puss.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The cat flees.

Dialogue.Line: Doctor, what are you doing?
They can make quite good eating. Small mammals are quite flavoursome when baked.
What are you saying? I don't understand.
I knew it would happen. I'm turning into an Androgum.
You can't!
You're not an Androgum. You're a Time Lord! Pull yourself together, Doctor.
Yes. Yes, that's right. I'm a Time Lord.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor sticks his head in a nearby fountain in the Plaza Dona Elvira.

Dialogue.Line: Are you better now?
Yes. Yes, yes, I'm all right. For the moment.
What on Earth have they had? Nobody can run up a bill for eighty one thousand, six hundred pesetas.
What? Let me see. They've had lobsters, clams, and squid, brains in white sauce, two whole suckling pigs, a ham with figs, eight steaks, and an entire family paella!
A whole paella?
And
That's twelve servings.
They've just ordered a dozen breasts of pigeons, probably to help down the last of their dozen bottles of wine.
What a gargantuan repast. It's incredible. And they're still eating!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Once again, our group hide from Chessene and Dastari.

Dialogue.Line: They've covered that way, so we'll go this.
I think they should start paying now, Oscar.
Yes. Well, leave it to me.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Oscar goes over to Shockeye and the second Doctor's table. The Doctor seems full, but Shockeye is still eating.

Dialogue.Line: I trust everything was to your satisfaction, gentlemen?
Oh, tolerable, tolerable.
May I say what a pleasure it has been to see two such dedicated trenchermen enjoying their food. Unfortunately the reckoning is rather high.
What is this?
Well, it's the amount you owe, sir.
Do you understand this?
He is asking for money.
Money?
Tokens of exchange.
This is our tally?
Yes, sir.
Ah.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Shockeye produces a bank note.

Dialogue.Line: Here. Keep the change.
I'm sorry, sir. I mean, I can see you're a wit as well as a bon vivant, but this, whatever it is, is not acceptable.
That is a twenty narg note! You can change that anywhere in the Nine Planets!
Well, it's not acceptable here, sir.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The sixth Doctor, Jamie and Peri arrive at Calle Vida. Peri spots a familiar name.

Dialogue.Line: Las Cadenas. (no stress on any syllable)
Las Cadenas. (stress on De.)
Well, isn't it where Oscar works?
Aye, I think that was the name. Mind you, there seems to be more places to eat in this town than you'd find fleas on a dog.
Dog? Where?
Oscar, you must stop them.
Yes. Yes, I must.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor is asleep, head on the tablecloth.

Dialogue.Line: Gentleman, if this is a joke, it has gone on long enough. If you don't wish to pay cash we can accept any recognised credit card.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Shockeye picks up a knife and puts it to Oscar's throat.

Dialogue.Line: I will pay you with this.
What?
Your whining importunacy has acidised my digestive juices.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Shockeye stabs Oscar. Anita screams, Oscar staggers to a chair while Anita makes a telephone call. The sixth Doctor, Peri and Jamie run in.

Dialogue.Line: Oscar!
What happened?
Officer. Promptly on the scene as always.
Let me see that.
Ridiculous thing to happen. Dissatisfied customers usually just don't leave a tip.
Doctor?
You're going to be all right, Oscar. I phoned for the ambulance and the Guardia Civil.
No, no, I'm afraid this is Botcherby's last curtain call.
Oh, no.
No one will ever see my definitive Hamlet now.
We will! We'll all be there on the first night, Oscar.
Yes.
To die, to sleep. To sleep, perchance to dream. Where are you, Anita?
I'm here.
Please, take care of my beautiful moths.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Oscar dies.

Dialogue.Line: Good night, sweet prince.
Doctor, just look at the Doctor. His face.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The characteristics of an Androgum fade from the second Doctor. The Doctor sits him up.

Dialogue.Line: Can you walk?
Walk? Of course I can walk.
Right. Come on.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor hauls him to his feet. He is heavy.

Dialogue.Line: I am a police officer. Come along with me, sir.
What is this?
Anything that you may say
Who do I think you are?
May be used in evidence against you.
We'd better go.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Jamie and Peri leave Anita weeping over Oscar.

Dialogue.Line: Now you come along with me!
How dare you! Let go of me!
This way!
No, this way.
Now look, you got me into this mess.
Will you two please stop squabbling? We'll go this way.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The men follow Peri.

Dialogue.Line: No. You'll come this way. We have some unfinished business to attend to.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Everyone raises their hands at the sight of Chessene's laser pistol. They are marched back to the hacienda, where Shockeye sees them from the bedroom window. He has changed back into his own clothes.

Dialogue.Line: Oh, my word, what a mess.
Mmm. I think perhaps, Dastari, you ought to sack your chatelaine.
Shockeye. What has happened here?
It seems that Group Marshal Stike vaporised his space craft and himself. I found this.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Shockeye holds up a lower leg.

Dialogue.Line: So he survived the coronic acid.
Obviously. Down to the cellars. You know the way, I think.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: She gives the pistol to Shockeye and leads the way.

Dialogue.Line: The control box has been moved. Is it damaged?
The Briode Nebuliser's missing.
Do you mean this?
Why did you remove it?
Because it contains my symbiotic print.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Chessene takes it from him.

Dialogue.Line: Return this to the machine.
How did your Time Lord imprint get into this?
Stike forced me to prime and use the machine.
There is a simple way of testing whether you are still trying to deceive us. Come, girl.
No!
Come, girl.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor nods as Chessene puts Peri into the module.

Dialogue.Line: Now we shall see.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Dastari operates the control panel. Peri and the module disappear.

Dialogue.Line: There you are.
Kartz and Reimer experimented like this many times. The subjects always vapourised into the time stream.
Peri won't. And she hasn't any symbiotic nuclei, I can assure you.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Dastari brings the module back, and Chessene opens the door.

Dialogue.Line: Out.
Satisfied?
Dastari, chain these creatures up.
Chain us up? After I've handed you the secret of time travel on a plate. Come on, Chessene. Where's your gratitude?
Dastari.
Come on. Come along.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Chessene and Shockeye are left alone.

Dialogue.Line: Madam, before we leave, let me cook one of the humans.
Didn't you sate your appetite sufficiently in the city?
A mere snack. You promised we could have a human before leaving Earth.
Well, if it would please you. Take the one in the skirt. He's the youngest of the jacks.
Thank you, madam.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Dastari has tied the two Doctors to a pillar base. Peri is opposite them. Shockeye grabs Jamie's arm and twists it behind his back.

Dialogue.Line: Get your hands off me!
Steady, my beauty. Oh, there's some juiceful meat on this one, Chessene.
Jamie!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Shockeye takes Jamie upstairs. Dastari places the manacle keys on a nearby table then leaves.

Dialogue.Line: You might at least say goodbye! You're almost as clever as I am.
What does he mean?
I presume you've sabotaged the Briode nebuliser?
Pared the interface.
Precisely what I would have done.
But it worked, didn't it?
I left a thin membrane so it would work once. I knew she'd want to test it.
There's no need to be so smug. We've got to get Jamie out of that butcher's hands.
Can you reach that wheelchair?
I'm not elastic.
I think you could reach it with your feet, if you try.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Peri just manages to reach it.

Dialogue.Line: Good girl!
What's the idea, Doctor?
Push it over towards him.
Why? He's not going anywhere.
Come along.
That's it!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The sixth Doctor uses his feet to manoeuvre the wheel chair under the table.

Dialogue.Line: What do you think?
It might work. It's worth a try.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor pushes the wheelchair foot rest under the table foot rest.

Dialogue.Line: That's it. Easy does it.
Right.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor tips the wheelchair onto its back, tipping the table at the same time. The keys fall to the floor and he kicks them to his hands and unmanacles himself. He's about to unfasten the second Doctor when there is a scream from upstairs.

Dialogue.Line: Never mind me. That's Jamie. Help him!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The sixth Doctor runs to the stairs.

Dialogue.Line: The key!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor throws the keys back across the floor.
Shockeye has tied Jamie to the kitchen table, and is applying what looks like a modified sanding tool to his thighs. It hurts.

Dialogue.Line: What are you doing?
Tenderising the meat. Oh, see how the flesh is marbling. That's the fatty tissue breaking up.
You should kill him first, surely?
It works better on a live animal.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Shockeye tenderises Jamie's chest.

Dialogue.Line: It looks very painful.
That's simply a nervous reflex. I've been butchering all my life. Primitive creatures don't feel pain in the way that we would.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Shockeye aims his device at Jamie's liver. The sixth Doctor is listening from the staircase. Shockeye exchanges the tenderiser for a large knife.

Dialogue.Line: Now, this is the part, I always say, where you can tell a butcher from a botcher. The meat should always have a clean edge.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Chessene storms in.

Dialogue.Line: Dastari, you fool! One of the Time Lords has escaped.
That's impossible.
You couldn't have fastened the manacle properly.
I tell you I did.
Don't argue! It's vital that he be caught and killed.
Chessene, listen to me. To kill a Time Lord would mean the destruction of everything we've achieved. The Gallifreyans have powers we've not even dreamed of.
Kill him, I tell you. Kill him!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Dastari takes the weapon Chessene holds out to him and leaves.

Dialogue.Line: This will only take a few minutes, madam. I thought we could have the saddle and the haunches for supper.
Never mind that now, Shockeye. I want that Time Lord found!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Chessene leaves. Shockeye puts down the knife and follows. Once the coast is clear, the Doctor comes down the stairs and into the kitchen.

Dialogue.Line: Jamie? Jamie, can you hear me?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Jamie just moans. The Doctor takes Shockeye's knife and cuts his feet and left hand free.

Dialogue.Line: Jamie, wake up.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Shockeye enters and takes the knife from the Doctor.

Dialogue.Line: I thought you might return to help the primitive.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor tries to free Jamie's right hand and gets a cut in the leg for his efforts. He runs outside before collapsing in pain then limping out of the main gate.

Dialogue.Line: Shockeye! The Time Lord.
I know, madam. I wounded him. Look.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: There is a blood pool on the bottom step.

Dialogue.Line: Then follow his blood trail. Kill him, Shockeye.
Certainly, madam.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Shockeye leaves. Dastari watches as Chessene backs away from the blood slowly before finally lying down and smearing the blood onto her hand. As she licks it, Dastari turns his head away.
Jamie wakes. He discovers that he is only tied to the table by one hand, so he slides off and gets Shockeye's knife to free himself.

Dialogue.Line: Right. I'll have that Shockeye, so I will.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The second Doctor frees Peri.

Dialogue.Line: Come along, Peri, it's time we were off.
Okay.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Dastari comes down the stairs.

Dialogue.Line: Chessene wants me to kill you.
Your run has nearly ended, Time Lord. Give up, Time Lord, you cannot escape Shockeye o' the Quauncing Grig!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor arrives at the place where the late Oscar left his moth hunting kit. He sniffs the contents of the killing jar, then pours some of the crystals onto the cotton wool pad and adds water. Shockeye is getting closer. He slows down and pulls his cutlass from his cummerbund as he approaches the kit on the ground.

Dialogue.Line: The blood is warm and salt, Time Lord. I know how near you are.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Shockeye leans against a tree trunk. The Doctor puts the net over his head and the cotton wool pad over his mouth. There is a brief struggle before the Doctor lowers Shockeye to the ground.

Dialogue.Line: Your just desserts.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Jamie goes down the stairs then hides underneath them as Chessene walks down.

Dialogue.Line: I remember it very clearly, Doctor. DOCTOR 2 [OC]: There speaks the real Dastari.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Dastari, the second Doctor and Peri are by the Kartz-Reimer Module.

Dialogue.Line: My old friend!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: They turn to see Chessene holding a gun on them.

Dialogue.Line: I ordered you to kill these two. Why are they still alive?
There's been enough killing, Chessene, and it's my fault. I took an Androgum, a lowly, unthinking creature of instinct, and tried to set her among the gods.
I put myself among the gods. And now I shall liberate my people. With me as their leader we shall reign over all other beings.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Dastari reaches for her, and she shoots him. The second Doctor and Peri try to run for it.

Dialogue.Line: Stop!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Jamie throws his knife, knocking the gun from her hand. Quickly, she gets into the module and operates it. It begins to shake and fill with smoke. Jamie beckons his Doctor and Peri over. The module explodes and Chessene falls out, screaming.

Dialogue.Line: Is she dead?
Very.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Chessene returns to the warty, red eyebrow appearance of an Androgum.

Dialogue.Line: Molecular disintegration. Horrible.
That's it then.
Aye, except for that Shockeye.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The sixth Doctor limps in.

Dialogue.Line: He's been, er, mothballed. My word, that's a mess! It'll take you a while to put that back together again!
That will not be necessary.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The second Doctor holds up a small thin device. The sixth Doctor makes a grab for it.

Dialogue.Line: A Stattenheim remote control? Where did you get that? I've always wanted one of those.
Some of us have earned these little privileges.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The second Doctor whistles and the Tardis materialises nearby. The Doctor opens the door.

Dialogue.Line: Jamie.
Er, after you, Doctor.
No, after you, Jamie.
Goodbye, Peri.
Bye.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Jamie and Peri shake hands, then Jamie kisses her on the cheek.

Dialogue.Line: Doctor.
Jamie. Keep an eye on the old gentleman, will you?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Jamie enters the Tardis.

Dialogue.Line: Do try and keep out of my way in future and in past, there's a good fellow. The time continuum should be big enough for the both of us. Just.
Do you know, I think I preferred you as an Androgum.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Second Doctor enters the Tardis. It dematerialises.

Dialogue.Line: Of all the conceited ingrates! Do you know, he almost succeeded in concealing my natural charm.
Was that your Tardis?
Mmm.
I don't understand. How can it be in two places at the same time?
That's the whole point. It's not in two places at the same time. My Tardis is at least five minutes walk from here. After you.
No, after you.
No, After you.
Doctor? We're not going fishing again, are we?
No. From now on it's a healthy vegetarian diet for both of us.
